Spreading out the HUD allowed IMPORTANT elements to be larger and focused on as needed, as well as easier to discern at a glance. When everything is crammed together, more focus is required to be removed from the game and spent focusing on the HUD to ensure that the proper information is gathered-- its useless.

In the midst of gameplay your eyes can't wander back and forth to find information, simply having to look down briefly helps this. Keeping information surrounding the minimap can force people to look at the map more and fix some tunnel vision issues.

The old HUD being spread out is actually the reason why they changed it. You're supposed to see all the stats without having to scan through the whole screen. If you need to look at your cooldowns, you had to look at the bottom and then to the left for your active items. Now, you just need to look at the bottom. If you want to know about anything game-related, you had to look at the minimap, but also to the top right and to the left. Now you just look at the bottom right (and Tab).

Just give it time, you'll learn to see everything all at once. You're currently just overwhelmed by all the information at one spot, but it's really better this way. It's easier to process clustered information than when it's spread out.

The only thing that could be improved is the fact that allied summoners and allied ult timers shown on 2 seperate places. This is because with the initial version of the new HUD these things didn't exist yet, but they added it based on feedback in the places where they could easily add them: AKA where the symbols already were.

it makes sense but.....peripheral vision...you don't need to stop looking at the middle if you are looking on the left because this is how our eyes works. If you want to see your friend hp, you don't just "stop looking in the middle to look at the left" you are spreading your vision or something like that.  You don't see clearly what's on the left, but you see the important detail while still playing. Ally hp bar is red? Shen ult time. Now the new character icon are so small it's hard to notice fast enough, but I do agree the new location kinda makes more sense. I just wish it would be less small.

When there is a HUGE amount of information to look at (like the actual stat thing) looking in periphery simply won't work. You have to REALLY take time and look down. 

But yeah, let's take at least one month to see if it works. I don't really hate the new hud, but I think it could be so much better.
